definition: to take/to borrow/to pick (flowers, fruit etc)/to pluck/to select/to remove/to take off (glasses, hat etc)
to make a copy/to plagiarize/to search and seize/to raid/to grab/to go off with/to take a shortcut/to make a turning move/to fold one's arms

sentences.english: He copied the relevant data out of the encyclopaedia.
sentences.chinese: 他從百科全書中摘抄了有關資料。

sentences.english: He says that by far the most commonplace form these days is cutting and pasting from the internet.
sentences.chinese: 他表示，目前最常見的就是從網上摘抄並粘貼。

sentences.english: " Excerpts " refers to the documentary evidence copied down from parts of the contents of the reserved copy.
sentences.chinese: 節錄本是指摘抄原文件部分內容的書證。

sentences.english: History notes, excerpt of the history books history books.
sentences.chinese: 史鈔，摘抄史部書的史籍。

definition: impression of a book/opinion expressed in a book review
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
to take down (in writing)/notes/a type of literature consisting mainly of short sketches/CL:本[ben3]
literal/word by word and phrase by phrase
excerpt/selection (from a book)/to select/to choose an extract
